Constructor Detail

BestModel

public BestModel(int k,
                 java.lang.String text1,
                 java.lang.String text2,
                 java.lang.String test)
Generate k-th order Markov models for text1 and text2 and calculate loglikelihoods of test against each model. These structures can then be queried to find best matches.

Method Detail

averageLogLikelihood

public double averageLogLikelihood(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> logs)
Given the HashMap logs, find the total value and divide it by the total number of Ngrams created

Returns:
a double average

chooseBestModel

public boolean chooseBestModel()
Given precalculated model1, model2 and loglike1 and loglike2 find best match to test

Returns:
true if text1 is best match and false if text2 is best match

confidence

public double confidence()
Returns:
confidence measure in best match

explainBestModel

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> explainBestModel(int topn)
Find the top n words for which the difference in the log probabilities of two models are greatest.

Parameters:
topn - int number of obs,difs to return
Returns:
HashMap top k strings and their loglikelihood differences between model 1 and model 2
